summary: This bill, the HOME Investment Partnerships Reauthorization and Improvement Act of 2025, aims to reauthorize and reform the HOME Investment Partnerships Program. It includes provisions for reauthorization, increased program administration resources, modifications to participating jurisdiction qualifications and reallocations, and reforms to program administration rules. Key changes involve amendments to affordable housing qualifications, elimination of commitment deadlines, reforms to homeownership resale restrictions, home property inspections, enforcement and penalties, and the establishment of a home loan guarantee program. The bill also addresses community housing development organization participation and makes technical corrections to the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act.
